es.upc.fib.prop.shared13

Class Edge

  • java.lang.Object
    • es.upc.fib.prop.shared13.Edge
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    LEdge, Relationship, TEdge

    public abstract class Edge
extends java.lang.Object
    Edge class representing undirected weighted graph edges. Created mainly by Albert Segarra with some contributions by Miquel Jubert.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Edge(Node m1, Node m2)
      Creates a weighted edge between two nodes with weight 1 and validity true.
      Edge(Node m1, Node m2, double w)
      Creates a weighted edge between two nodes with weight w and validity true.
      Edge(Node m1, Node m2, double w, boolean valid)
      Creates a weighted edge between two nodes with weight w and validity v.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean equals(java.lang.Object o) 
      Node getNeighbor(Node n)
      If n is a node that belongs to the edge (i.e the edge contains a node n' such that n.equals(n')), this function returns its neighbor.
      Node getNode()
      Returns the smallest node of the edge.
      double getWeight()
      Returns the edge's weight.
      int hashCode()
      Returns a hash code value for this edge.
      boolean isValid()
      Returns whether the edge is valid.
      void setValidity(boolean valid)
      Sets the edge validity to equal the parameter valid.
      void setWeight(double w)
      Edge's weight setter.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Returns a String representation of the edge.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Edge

        public Edge(Node m1,
    Node m2,
    double w,
    boolean valid)
        Creates a weighted edge between two nodes with weight w and validity v. Note that the node weight must be a strictly positive number.
        Parameters:
        m1 - one of the nodes of the edge.
        m2 - the other node of the edge.
        w - the weight of the edge.
        valid - the validity of the edge.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if m1 is null or m2 is null.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if w is not a strictly positive number.

      • Edge

        public Edge(Node m1,
    Node m2,
    double w)
        Creates a weighted edge between two nodes with weight w and validity true. Note that the node weight must be a strictly positive number.
        Parameters:
        m1 - one of the nodes of the edge.
        m2 - the other node of the edge.
        w - the weight of the edge.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if m1 is null or m2 is null.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if w is not a strictly positive number.

      • Edge

        public Edge(Node m1,
    Node m2)
        Creates a weighted edge between two nodes with weight 1 and validity true. Note that the node weight must be a strictly positive number.
        Parameters:
        m1 - one of the nodes of the edge.
        m2 - the other node of the edge.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if m1 is null or m2 is null.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if w is not a strictly positive number.

    • Method Detail

      • setWeight

        public void setWeight(double w)
        Edge's weight setter. The supplied weight value must be a strictly positive number.
        Parameters:
        w - the desired weight value for the edge.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the weight is not a strictly positive number.

      • setValidity

        public void setValidity(boolean valid)
        Sets the edge validity to equal the parameter valid.
        Parameters:
        valid - the desired validity for the edge.

      • getNeighbor

        public Node getNeighbor(Node n)
        If n is a node that belongs to the edge (i.e the edge contains a node n' such that n.equals(n')), this function returns its neighbor.
        Parameters:
        n - the node whose neighbor is requested.
        Returns:
        given one of the two nodes of the edge, it returns the other one.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if n is null.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if n is not one of the nodes of the edge.

      • getNode

        public Node getNode()
        Returns the smallest node of the edge.
        Returns:
        the smallest node of the edge.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object o)
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        o - The object to compare with the edge.
        Returns:
        returns true if the object o is an instance of edge, it is not null and it contains the same nodes as the edge o (no matter the order).

      • hashCode

        public int hashCode()
        Returns a hash code value for this edge.
        Overrides:
        hashCode in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        returns a hash code value for this edge.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a String representation of the edge. Note that the nodes of the edge are printed in increasing order, so for instance if nodes were integers both edge 3,2 and edge 2,3 would be printed as 2,3.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        a String representation of the edge.

      • getWeight

        public double getWeight()
        Returns the edge's weight.
        Returns:
        the edge's weight.

      • isValid

        public boolean isValid()
        Returns whether the edge is valid. This method is useful for some algorithms that need to remove all edges and then keep adding them one by one.
        Returns:
        true if the edge is valid.
